articles.title: Earth's Spin to Speed Up Briefly, Causing Shorter Days This Summer
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: Earth will spin faster on July 9, 22, and August 5, shortening summer days by 1.3 to 1.5 milliseconds, according to scientists. The shift is undetectable in daily life, but it offers clues about the Earth's rotation.

articles.author: Damien MEYER
articles.summary: Extremes in temperature and rainfall in the UK are becoming increasingly frequent. England and Wales endured the wettest winter in 250 years. Six of the 10 wetest winters in the 21st century occurred in the last 10 years of the century.

articles.title: Signal no 3 hoisted at seaports as low pressure formed over north Bay
articles.author: United News
articles.summary: A low-pressure area has formed over the North Bay and adjoining coastal regions of Bangladesh, prompting authorities to hoist local cautionary signal No 3 at four seaports. The BMD has advised the ports of Chattogram, Cox's Bazar, Mongla, and Payra to keep the signal hoisted until further notice. Fishermen and operators of fishing boats and trawlers are advised to proceed with caution and remain close to the coast.
